personal.title: Flexicar
personal.description: Flexicar is a modern, responsive landing page for a fictional car rental service. It showcases clean design, smooth layout, and a strong focus on accessibility and mobile-first responsiveness — all built using only HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript.

personal.title: Meme Catalog
personal.description: Meme Catalog is a responsive web application that allows users to explore, view, and manage a collection of memes. Built with React and styled using Tailwind CSS and HeroUI, the app features an interactive table view and card view, complete with editing modals and real-time form validation.

personal.title: Spider - Man Hero Page
personal.description: A responsive heroine page inspired by the style of Spider-Man: No Way Home. The project was created with a focus on modern design, animation, a mobile-first approach, and optimization for different screens.

personal.title: Web Studio
personal.description: This is my first educational project — a multi-section landing page for a fictional web studio. It was built from scratch using only HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, focusing on the fundamentals of responsive layout, semantic structure, and basic DOM interactions.

team.title: Cinemania
team.description: Web application for browsing and managing movies. I was responsible for implementing the movie catalog grid on the CATALOG page. I integrated the API to fetch and display selected movies and developed a dynamic rating system with stars

team.title: MIMINO Hotel-Restaurant Complex
team.description: Website for a hotel and restaurant complex. I was responsible for the HOTEL page, where I developed the room descriptions and implemented responsive image sliders using Swiper.js

team.title: GooseTrack
team.description: A full-featured task management web app built as a final team project. Includes user authentication, calendar-based task planning, personal dashboards, and activity statistics. My role was to develop the Statistics page: I implemented responsive layout, data visualization using Chart.js, and integrated real-time data from Redux store
